author: Special Correspondent
text:
In the Swachh Bharat survey, Chennai is rated low in waste management, processing and disposal with a score of 25 out of 200.

Sanitation facilities such as public toilet provision were inadequate with a score of 94/150.

Communication, information, education and behaviour change communication activity was, however, better with a score of 46/50.

Sweeping, collection and transportation of waste received a score of 313/400.

An official of Greater Chennai Corporation said the ranking had improved this year.

“Conditions will improve with various new initiatives such as e-toilets and collection of waste,” the official said.

However, the city

fared better in sweeping, collection and transportation of waste
title: Chennai scores 25/200 in waste management
